intro: Cudicia gyrandra, commonly known as the mountain candelabra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, branched structure that resembles a candelabra. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. Cudicia gyrandra thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
